intro: Tetradymia canescens, commonly known as the grayleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its grayish-blue foliage. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Tetradymia canescens is often found in sagebrush steppe and other arid environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems.
